DataElement.preferredName: G-8 Screening Tool P Comparison Health Status Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric score that represents, in comparison with other people of the same age, how a person considers their health status, using a 4-point scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: G-8 Screening Tool Comparison of Health Status Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tool for the assessment of geriatric cancer patients. It combines 7 questions from the mini nutritional assessment (MNA) with one question regarding subject age. Items selected from MNA concern nutritional status, weight loss, body mass index, motor skills, psychological status, number of medications, and self-perception of health._A question about how an individual considers their health status in comparison to others of the same age._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tool for the assessment of geriatric cancer patients. It combines 7 questions from the mini nutritional assessment (MNA) with one question regarding subject age. ReferenceDocuments.name: In comparison with other peop
ReferenceDocuments.description: In comparison with other people of the same age, how does the patient consider his/her health status?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

DataElement.origin: G-8:Geriatric 8 Screening Tool, C.A. Bellera, et al. Annals of Oncology 23: 2166-2172, 2012
